notes.text:
An update for firefox is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Important. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Mozilla Firefox is an open-source web browser, designed for standards compliance, performance, and portability.

This update upgrades Firefox to version 91.9.0 ESR.

Security Fix(es):

* Mozilla: Bypassing permission prompt in nested browsing contexts (CVE-2022-29909)

* Mozilla: iframe Sandbox bypass (CVE-2022-29911)

* Mozilla: Fullscreen notification bypass using popups (CVE-2022-29914)

* Mozilla: Leaking browser history with CSS variables (CVE-2022-29916)

* Mozilla: Memory safety bugs fixed in Firefox 100 and Firefox ESR 91.9 (CVE-2022-29917)

* Mozilla: Reader mode bypassed SameSite cookies (CVE-2022-29912)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
notes.title: Details

notes.text:
The Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory describes this flaw as:

Documents in deeply-nested cross-origin browsing contexts could have obtained permissions granted to the top-level origin, bypassing the existing prompt and wrongfully inheriting the top-level permissions.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Mozilla: Bypassing permission prompt in nested browsing contexts
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: Red Hat Product Security rates the severity of this flaw as determined by the Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

After installing the update, Firefox must be restarted for the changes to take effect.

vulnerabilities.title: Mozilla: Bypassing permission prompt in nested browsing contexts

cwe.name: Improper Restriction of Rendered UI Layers or Frames

notes.text: A flaw was found in Mozilla. The Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory describes the issue of Firefox not protecting against top-level navigations for an iframe sandbox with a policy relaxed through a keyword likely to allow top-navigation-by-user-activation.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Mozilla: iframe Sandbox bypass
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

After installing the update, Firefox must be restarted for the changes to take effect.

cwe.name: Reliance on Cookies without Validation and Integrity Checking

notes.text: A flaw was found in Mozilla. The Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory describes the issue of requests initiated through the reader mode did not properly omit cookies with a SameSite attribute.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Mozilla: Reader mode bypassed SameSite cookies
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

After installing the update, Firefox must be restarted for the changes to take effect.

vulnerabilities.title: Mozilla: Reader mode bypassed SameSite cookies

cwe.name: Improper Restriction of Rendered UI Layers or Frames

notes.text: A flaw was found in Mozilla. The Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory describes the issue of when reusing existing popups; Firefox allowed them to cover the fullscreen notification UI, which possibly enabled browser spoofing attacks.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Mozilla: Fullscreen notification bypass using popups
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

After installing the update, Firefox must be restarted for the changes to take effect.

vulnerabilities.title: Mozilla: Fullscreen notification bypass using popups

cwe.name: Exposure of Sensitive System Information to an Unauthorized Control Sphere

notes.text: A flaw was found in Mozilla. The Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory describes the issue of Firefox behaving slightly differently for already known resources when loading CSS resources involving CSS variables. This flaw could probe the browser history.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Mozilla: Leaking browser history with CSS variables
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

After installing the update, Firefox must be restarted for the changes to take effect.

vulnerabilities.title: Mozilla: Leaking browser history with CSS variables

cwe.name: Buffer Copy without Checking Size of Input ('Classic Buffer Overflow')

notes.text:
The Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory describes this flaw as:

Mozilla developers Andrew McCreight, Gabriele Svelto, Tom Ritter and the Mozilla Fuzzing Team reported memory safety bugs present in Firefox 99 and Firefox ESR 91.8. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effort some of these could have been exploited to run arbitrary code.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Mozilla: Memory safety bugs fixed in Firefox 100 and Firefox ESR 91.9
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

After installing the update, Firefox must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
